thread.title: Prisoner found dead in cell at Strangeways prison
thread.title_full: Prisoner found dead in cell at Strangeways prison

author: Charlotte Dobson
title: Prisoner found dead in cell at Strangeways prison
text:
News Prisoner found dead in cell at Strangeways prison It is understood prison guards were alerted to a man in one the cells shortly before 8.30pm on Thursday night Share Get daily   Could   
An inmate has died in Strangeways prison. 
It is understood prison guards were alerted to a man in one the cells shortly before 8.30pm on Thursday night. 
Bosses at the Category A prison, which houses 1,300 inmates, have confirmed tonight a prisoner had died. 
The age of the inmate or the cause of his death are yet to be disclosed. 
The M.E.N. has contacted the Ministry of Justice for further details. Read More Investigation launched after one inmate dies and another collapses at Salford's Forest Bank prison 
Officials have not yet released any statement but have confirmed the tragic incident. 
Sources from inside the prison say that shocked staff were dealing with the incident after finding the man’s body in a cell on the prison’s A-wing. 
The man’s death is the second prison fatality in Greater Manchester to take place within a week. 
On Sunday an inmate collapsed and died at Salford’s Forest Bank prison. Read More Pictured: Moment bungling burglar got stuck in bathroom window 
Another prisoner was also found collapsed on the previous day. 
Prison insiders said reports that the death and the collapse of another inmate 24 hours earlier were linked to the use of a synthetic drug known as Spice are ‘speculation’. 
Bosses at Forest Bank are currently carrying out an investigation into the incident. Like us on Facebook
